channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-21753] Update HiveMetastore authorization to enable use of HiveAuthorizer implementation
item.description: Currently HMS supports authorization using StorageBasedAuthorizationProvider which relies on permissions at filesystem – like HDFS. Hive supports a pluggable authorization interface, and multiple authorizer implementations (like SQLStd, Ranger, Sentry) are available to authorizer access in Hive. Extending HiveMetastore to use the same authorization interface as Hive will enable use of pluggable authorization implementations; and will result in consistent authorization across Hive, HMS and other services that use HMS (like Spark).
item.summary: Update HiveMetastore authorization to enable use of HiveAuthorizer implementation

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Please also upload the patch, naming it HIVE-21753.1.patch, so we can get ptest run and post test result.
daijy I have attached the patch. Thanks.
daijy Review addressed and patch attached with pull request
daijythejas I have fixed the review comments and created a new pull request. Thanks.

-1 overall

rmani - Very thankful for commenting on GitHub! I am m44444 there. Just one question if I could, seems like this PR will be released with 4.0.0, can this patch be back ported to earlier versions in 2.x and 3.x? Thank you!
rmani There is some problem in your latest patch file. The authEvent in L151 and L160 in HiveMetaStoreAuthorizer is not correct fro ALTER_TABLE and DROP_TABLE.

rmani
Hello, first of all, thanks for this contribution.
I just want to ask a question.
Does it work with kerberos enabled?
I keep encountering Kerberos error when I access to HiveMetastore through spark-sql.

This is a log from HiveMetastore.
